Content.Name: BYU-I SDO & NSSE: To Know
Content.Title: BYU-I SDO & NSSE: To Know
Content.BodyCopy:
Connections

The tables that follow connect the "To Know" section ofo BYU-Idaho's Student Development Outcomes (SDO) to various questions from the National Survey of Student Engagement (NSSE).

Please read through the tables and ask if the connections between the NSSE and the development outcomes seem reasonable and, more importantly, what the tables say about the engagement of our students in the learning process.  What steps toward improvement do the data suggest to you?

When asked if they anticipated completing a culminating senior experience such as a capstone course, senior project, thesis, or comprehensive exam, BYU-Idaho seniors reported a 0.29 score (0 = Have not decided, Do not plan to; 1 = Plan to, Done).  How might student learning be enhanced by an integrative, culminating experience?  Is there an argument to be made for the status quo?

BYU-Idaho seniors scored a 2.95 on a 4-point scale (1 = Never, 2 = Sometimes, 3 = Often, 4 = Very often) when asked how often they had examined the strengths and weaknesses of their views on a topic or issue during the current school year.  What does this suggest about the impact of our teaching?  How might we enhance our impact?

Our seniors reported a 3.00 score (1 = Never, 2 = Sometimes, 3 = Often, 4 = Very often) when asked how often they had put together ideas from different courses when completing assignments or during class discussions?  How can we build on that to increase the wholeness of a BYU-Idaho education?

 

  • Learn How to Learn

  • Learn deeply and broadly

  • Cultivate focused learning

  • Apply and expand your learning

  • Elevate your learning

 

 

 

BYU-Idaho SDO - Learn how to learn

NSSE 11j - Learning efffectively on your own.
To what extent has your experience at this institution contributed to your knowledge, skills, and personal development in ______?   1=Very little, 2=Some, 3=Quite a bit, 4=Very much
Year BYU-Idaho Peers Carnegie Peers All NSSE
First Year 2006 3.18 2.88 2.97 2.85
2011 3.23 2.92 2.96 2.98
Seniors 2006 3.21 3.05 3.09 3.00
2011 3.23 2.98 3.09 3.07

2011 3.40 3.19 3.30 3.24

BYU-Idaho SDO - Seek opportunities to apply and expand your learning.

BYU-Idaho SDO: Elevate your learning from remembering information to understanding principles; apply your understanding by acting for righteous purposes in real-world settings.

NSSE 1d - Worked on a paper or project that required integrating ideas or information from various sources.
In your experience at your institution during the current school year, about how often have you _____?  1=Never, 2=Sometimes, 3=Often, 4=Very often
Year BYU-Idaho Peers Carnegie Peers All NSSE
First Year 2006 3.01 2.97 3.12 3.03
2011 3.05 3.04 3.15 3.10
Seniors 2006 3.25 3.24 3.38 3.30
2011 3.31 3.29 3.39 3.34
